alert.note: Alert for Kay; Noble (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Kay and northwestern Noble Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 259 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southeast of Billings, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Red Rock, Marland, Sooner Lake and Ceres. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 194 and 207. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
